Remove `set_page_config` restrictions (#11286)

This PR remove the two `st.set_page_config` restrictions:
- It can only be called as the first `st` command (with some exceptions)
- It can only be called once per script run
The properties are additive (if the first call sets a `page_title` and the second call sets a `page_icon`, the page now has both the provided title & icon). This also applies for `menu_items`.

Fix typos in multiple files (#11311)

Fix typos in multiple files found by codespell

Add mega tester app to e2e tests to check for console and CSP errors (#10882)

## Describe your changes

This adds the mega tester app from
https://github.com/streamlit/mega-tester to our e2e tests. This allows
us to run the mega tester app and check for web console errors and
potential CSP errors using a CSP policy similar to SiS.

Enforce python typing annotations (#11289)

## Describe your changes

Enforces the correct usage of python typing annotations by:
- Activating the [flake8-annotations
(ANN)](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/#flake8-annotations-ann)
linting rule set.
- Activating `disallow_incomplete_defs` in mypy

This PR also adds typing annotations wherever it was missing. The next
step is to prevent fully untyped methods by setting
`ignore-fully-untyped = false` in the Ruff config and to activate type
checking via mypy in the `e2e_playwright` folder.

There are **no logical changes** in this PR.

Add safeguard for cached messages cleanup (#11302)

## Describe your changes

There seems to be an error case with the new forward message cache,
resulting in a cache miss. One theory why this might happen:

1. User triggers rerun (with cache message A)
2. Frontend receives finished message from the previous rerun ->
cleaning up cached message A
3. Frontend receives new session message from new rerun
4. Frontend receives reference message for message A -> crash

This PR would prevent this issue by ignoring the finished message from
the previous script run.

There is another potential error scenario:
 1. User triggers rerun 1 (with cache message A) 
 2. User triggers rerun 2 (with cache message A)
 3. Frontend receives new session message for rerun 1
 4. Frontend receives finished message for rerun 1
 5. Frontend receives new session message for rerun 2
 6. Frontend receives finished message for rerun 2

However, I'm not sure if this scenario is feasible. It would require
very fast user interactions paired with very fast script executions.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

- Closes https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/11299
- Closes https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/11300

## Testing Plan

- Added unit test
- Very hard to e2e test this.

---

Consolidate vertical and horizontal containers (#10960)

## Describe your changes

As part of the Advanced Layouts project, we are extending `st.container`
to be configurable as a flex container. This PR does some refactoring in
preparation for these changes.

Key Changes:

- Create a general `FlexBoxContainer` component that may be vertical or
horizontal. When the flex container changes are rolled out, this will be
configurable by the user, but currently it is just configured in
`layouts.py` to replace the existing vertical container and the
horizontal wrapper for a set of columns.
- Create a general `ContainerContentsWrapper` component that will be
used as a wrapper for the contents of other container types (e.g.
popover, expander) and also in AppView to wrap the contents of the main
app view.

Underneath, both of these components use the same
`StyledFlexContainerBlock` underneath, but the
`ContainerContentsWrapper` is simpler because it doesn't need to handle
the configuration from the user.

These changes should make it easier to reason about the more complex
changes that are going to be added by the advanced layouts project.

This also simplifies the protos required when we rollout the flex
container.


## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

## Testing Plan

- Explanation of why no additional tests are needed
- Unit Tests (JS and/or Python)
- E2E Tests
- Any manual testing needed?

Scroll long latex formulas horizontally (#10071)

## Describe your changes

Today, long Latex formulas overflow the page width, which looks weird
and can make the entire app scroll:
![CleanShot 2024-12-23 at 18 40
56@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fdcc1e48-f3b2-4f2e-97e3-5a5c8ce2896d)

With this change, we get the following behavior instead:
![CleanShot 2024-12-23 at 18 40
14](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e229940a-01af-433c-bc52-25e477fcf815)

Specifically:
- Latex formulas that are in their own paragraph in `st.markdown` scroll
horizontally.
- Latex formulas created with `st.latex` scroll horizontally. 
- This doesn't touch Latex formulas that are inline with other text
(e.g. `"foo $formula$ bar"`). I.e. these can still overflow and cause
the entire app to scroll. I didn't touch this because it was a bit
harder to fix nicely. I also think more and more we shouldn't fix that
by controlling the overflow of the Latex formula but just preventing the
entire app from scrolling horizontally. Anyway, I think this shouldn't
happen very often anyway because inline Latex formulas are usually
short.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Closes #4304

Should also update this forum post:
https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/streamlit-latex-auto-wrapping-responsive-layout/7975/3

## Testing Plan

Added e2e tests for the two cases above.

Provide more predictable fuzzy matching (#11309)

## Describe your changes

This change migrates away from fzy.js to vendored code with small
modifications/improvements including types, and handling case
sensitivity (It's MIT licensed).

Also minor, but the sorting for the options is using the negative filter
rather than reversing the list. This keeps the sorting more stable and
not move options completely around (minor perf benefit).

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

closes #11218

## Testing Plan

- JS unit tests added for the predictable searching as well as the
fzy.js including case sensitivity logic

Make Carto the default map provider (like in PyDeck) (#11231)

## Describe your changes

**Background:**

st.pydeck_chart and st.map currently use Mapbox as their default map
provider. However, Mapbox requires users to pass an API key first. In
the past, we provided a default API key for users, but the whole thing
always had a funny smell.

Somewhat recently, Pydeck changed their default map provider from Mapbox
to Carto -- which _does not_ require an API key. But this didn't apply
to Streamlit users because we had overridden the default with Mapbox.

This PR addresses this.

**What this PR does:**
1. Makes Streamlit follow Pydeck's behavior by using Carto by default.
2. No longer fetches our Mapbox API key from the cloud.
3. Deprecates the `mapbox.token` config option. We now refer users to
Pydeck's `api_keys` arg or `MAPBOX_API_KEY` env var. The old config
option is still supported, though.
4. Totally unrelated, but this also cleans up the docs for some config
options, so they print better with `streamlit config show`.

NOTE: For this to work in locked-down hosts (like Snowflake) they'll
have to add this to their CSP allow list:
```
connect-src: https://basemaps.cartocdn.com/ https://*.basemaps.cartocdn.com/
```

Or, if you want to be really picky...
```
connect-src: https://basemaps.cartocdn.com/ https://tiles.basemaps.cartocdn.com/ https://tiles-b.basemaps.cartocdn.com/  https://tiles-c.basemaps.cartocdn.com/  https://tiles-d.basemaps.cartocdn.com/
```
...but I worry Carto may add mote tile servers in the future and this
will be a forever game.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Fix #10475: Warn when modifying elements inside fragment callback (#10942)

## Describe your changes

Added a new warning mechanism to detect and alert developers when
modifying Streamlit elements inside a fragment widget's callback. This
addresses potential unexpected UI behaviors and improves developer
guidance for proper fragment usage.

Key modifications:
- Implemented `_maybe_print_fragment_callback_warning()` function
- Checks if code is running inside a fragment callback
- Raises a warning when elements are modified during fragment callbacks
- Provides clear guidance to developers on proper callback structure

## GitHub Issue Link
[Issue #10475](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/10475)

## Testing Plan

### Unit Tests Added
1. Test warning appears when modifying elements inside a fragment
callback
2. Verify no warning is raised for callbacks outside of fragments
3. Confirm no warning when callback does not interact with elements

Allow nesting expander, columns, popover and chat_message (#11272)

## Describe your changes

Removes the limitations to nest `st.expander`, `st.columns`,
`st.popover` and `st.chat_message` inside the same layout container
type.

- Closes #3861

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this
project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

Enforce a maximum line length via ruff (#11271)

## Describe your changes

Activates the `E501 `linting rule in ruff to enforce a maximum line
length configured in the ruff config (120 chars). Note: our code
formatter is configured with 88 chars, the 120 chars mainly applies to
long strings and comments.

There are quite a few more cases that should be updated within our unit
tests. But to keep this change manageable, we are deactivating this for
our unit tests for now.

Activate rules to prevent exception handling anti-patterns (#11282)

## Describe your changes

Activates linting rules to prevent exception handling anti-patterns in
Python:

(TRY)](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/#tryceratops-try)
-
[N818](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/error-suffix-on-exception-name/)

Ensure script lifecycle occurs for MPAv1 use case (#11258)

## Describe your changes

Changes in the MPA v1 handling inadvertently caused issues in clearing
widget state. This is a result of the script lifecycle ending
prematurely. This change forces all pages to run completely and exec in
the case of MPAv0/2

closes #11202

- E2E Tests adds this test case

Bump lighthouse from 12.5.1 to 12.6.0 in /frontend (#11241) Bumps [lighthouse](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse) from 12.5.1 to 12.6.0.
Release notes

Sourced from lighthouse's releases.

v12.6.0

Full Changelog

We expect this release to ship in the DevTools of Chrome 137, and to PageSpeed Insights within a few days.

New contributors

Thanks to our new contributors 👽🐷🐰🐯🐻!

Jack Franklin @​jackfranklin Rob Kodey @​rkodey Clément Barbaza @​cba85

Notable Changes

The Performance category in the Lighthouse report now has an option to toggle "insights" - read more here.

Core

  • disable invalidationTracking trace event to prevent crash (#16451)
  • migrate audits from devtoolsLogs/traces to DevtoolsLog/Trace (#16448)
  • modify scoreDisplayMode for insight audits to match Perf panel (#16432)
  • use with import attributes for legacy-javascript, bump to node 18.20 (#16415)
  • image-size-responsive: use real mimeType to exclude svg (#16443)
  • insights: drop slow-css-selector-insight for now (#16457)
  • insights: implement duplicated-javascript-insight (#16456)
  • insights: add prominent toggle banner to report (#16461)
  • insights: implement network-dependency-tree insight (#16407)
  • optimized-images: ignore internal encoding errors (#16444)
  • preload-fonts: add Stylesheets to required artifacts (#16421)
  • stacks: correctly identify angular (#16439)
  • third-party-cookies: update description (#16464)
  • tracehouse: fixup parent tasks when fudging endTime (#16420)

Report

  • add analytics hook for insights state (#16466)
  • adjust insights notice banner, localize strings (#16463)
  • add insights group description (#16455)
  • associate insight audits with stack packs (#16440)
  • tweak style of insight tables; use system font (#16434)
  • support node inside list detail, use in insight audits (#16433)
  • display insights when using toggle, even if hidden (#16431)

Deps

  • upgrade trace_engine to 0.0.52 (#16465)
  • upgrade trace_engine to 0.0.51 (#16447)
  • upgrade deps (#16438)

... (truncated)
